executive_summary.one_line_conclusion: Quantum computing poses existential threats to current cybersecurity infrastructure requiring immediate preparation and post-quantum cryptography adoption.

three_bullets.bullet: Shor's algorithm threatens all public-key cryptography in 10-20 years
Post-quantum cryptography standards are emerging but not mature
System-wide infrastructure replacement will be costly and complex

initial_positions.quantum_physicist: Your assessment of quantum computing capabilities indicates cryptographically relevant quantum computers (CRQCs) are possible within the next 10-20 years, fundamentally threatening current public-key cryptographic systems.
initial_positions.cybersecurity_architect: Current cybersecurity infrastructure relies heavily on RSA and elliptic curve cryptography that will be vulnerable to quantum attacks, requiring comprehensive system replacement.
initial_positions.technology_policy: Government and industry must begin transition planning now, as the infrastructure replacement timeline will likely exceed the quantum threat timeline.

critical_conflict.issue: Urgency of response and resource allocation - cybersecurity sees immediate crisis, policy sees manageable transition

criticism.highlight: Policy analyst correctly identified governance challenges
criticism.vulnerability: Underestimated the immediacy of the threat timeline
criticism.compromise: Combine realistic planning timeline with accelerated implementation pathways

criticism.highlight: Technical assessment of vulnerabilities is thorough
criticism.vulnerability: Focus on technical solutions without sufficient consideration of policy constraints
criticism.compromise: Integrate policy feasibility into technical roadmap planning

agreed_findings.finding: Cryptographically relevant quantum computers likely within 10-20 years
All public key cryptography will be vulnerable
Transition requires significant coordination and resources

immediate_actions.action: Begin inventory of cryptographic assets across all systems
Start pilot programs with post-quantum cryptography standards
Develop policy frameworks for coordinated transition

longer_term.action: Complete transition to post-quantum cryptographic standards
Establish ongoing quantum threat monitoring systems

check.note: All theses reference original context and objective
Directly addresses quantum computing cybersecurity impact
All claims supported by expert assessment
